trans-unit.source: Use Azure Mobile Services and Notification Hubs to send notifications to your Windows Phone app
trans-unit.target: Use Azure Mobile Services and Notification Hubs to send notifications to your Windows Phone app

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Notification Hubs with Azure mobile services to send push notifications to your Windows phone app.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Notification Hubs with Azure mobile services to send push notifications to your Windows phone app.

trans-unit.source: This topic shows you how to use Azure Mobile Services with a .NET backend to send push notifications to a Windows Phone Silverlight 8 app using the Microsoft Push Notification Service (MPNS).
trans-unit.target: This topic shows you how to use Azure Mobile Services with a .NET backend to send push notifications to a Windows Phone Silverlight 8 app using the Microsoft Push Notification Service (MPNS).

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial you enable push notifications using Azure Notification Hubs to the quickstart project.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial you enable push notifications using Azure Notification Hubs to the quickstart project.

trans-unit.source: When complete, your mobile service will send a push notification using Notification Hubs each time a record is inserted.
trans-unit.target: When complete, your mobile service will send a push notification using Notification Hubs each time a record is inserted.

trans-unit.source: The notification hub that you create is free with your mobile service, can be managed independent of the mobile service, and can be used by other applications and services.
trans-unit.target: The notification hub that you create is free with your mobile service, can be managed independent of the mobile service, and can be used by other applications and services.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial is based on the Mobile Services TodoList project.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial is based on the Mobile Services TodoList project.

trans-unit.source: Before you start this tutorial, you must first complete [Add Mobile Services to an existing app] to connect your project to the mobile service.
trans-unit.target: Before you start this tutorial, you must first complete [Add Mobile Services to an existing app] to connect your project to the mobile service.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial targets Windows Phone 8.1 Silverlight apps.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial targets Windows Phone 8.1 Silverlight apps.

trans-unit.source: If you are instead building a Windows Phone 8.1 Store app, see the <linkText>Windows Store app</linkText><title></title> version of this tutorial.
trans-unit.target: If you are instead building a Windows Phone 8.1 Store app, see the <linkText>Windows Store app</linkText><title></title> version of this tutorial.

trans-unit.source: For information on Windows Phone Silverlight apps and how they compare with Windows Phone Store apps, see [Windows Phone Silverlight 8.1 apps].
trans-unit.target: For information on Windows Phone Silverlight apps and how they compare with Windows Phone Store apps, see [Windows Phone Silverlight 8.1 apps].

trans-unit.source: Before your app can receive push notifications, you must register a notification channel.
trans-unit.target: Before your app can receive push notifications, you must register a notification channel.

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio, open the file App.xaml.cs and add the following using statement:
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio, open the file App.xaml.cs and add the following using statement:

trans-unit.source: Add the following AcquirePushChannel method to App class:
trans-unit.target: Add the following AcquirePushChannel method to App class:

trans-unit.source: This code retrieves the channel URI for the app if it exists.
trans-unit.target: This code retrieves the channel URI for the app if it exists.

trans-unit.source: Otherwise, it will be created.
trans-unit.target: Otherwise, it will be created.

trans-unit.source: The channel URI is then opened and bound for toast notifications.
trans-unit.target: The channel URI is then opened and bound for toast notifications.

trans-unit.source: Once the channel URI is completely opened, the handler for the ChannelUriUpdated method is called and the channel is registered to received push notifications.
trans-unit.target: Once the channel URI is completely opened, the handler for the ChannelUriUpdated method is called and the channel is registered to received push notifications.

trans-unit.source: If the registration should fail, the channel is closed so that subsequent executions of the app can try registration again.
trans-unit.target: If the registration should fail, the channel is closed so that subsequent executions of the app can try registration again.

trans-unit.source: The ShellToastNotificationReceived handler is setup so that the app can receive and handle push notifications while running.
trans-unit.target: The ShellToastNotificationReceived handler is setup so that the app can receive and handle push notifications while running.

trans-unit.source: In the Application_Launching event handler in App.xaml.cs, add the following call to the new AcquirePushChannel method:
trans-unit.target: In the Application_Launching event handler in App.xaml.cs, add the following call to the new AcquirePushChannel method:

trans-unit.source: This makes sure that registration is requested every time that the app is loaded.
trans-unit.target: This makes sure that registration is requested every time that the app is loaded.

trans-unit.source: In your app, you may only want to make this registration periodically to ensure that the registration is current.
trans-unit.target: In your app, you may only want to make this registration periodically to ensure that the registration is current.

trans-unit.source: Press the F5 key to run the app.
trans-unit.target: Press the F5 key to run the app.

trans-unit.source: A popup dialog with the registration key is displayed.
trans-unit.target: A popup dialog with the registration key is displayed.

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio, open the Package.appxmanifest file and make sure that Toast capable is set to Yes on the Application UI tab.
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio, open the Package.appxmanifest file and make sure that Toast capable is set to Yes on the Application UI tab.

trans-unit.source: This makes sure that your app can raise toast notifications.
trans-unit.target: This makes sure that your app can raise toast notifications.

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio Solution Explorer, expand the Controllers folder in the mobile service project.
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio Solution Explorer, expand the Controllers folder in the mobile service project.

trans-unit.source: Open TodoItemController.cs and update the PostTodoItem method definition with the following code:
trans-unit.target: Open TodoItemController.cs and update the PostTodoItem method definition with the following code:

trans-unit.source: This code will send a push notification (with the text of the inserted item) after inserting a todo item.
trans-unit.target: This code will send a push notification (with the text of the inserted item) after inserting a todo item.

trans-unit.source: In the event of an error, the code will add an error log entry which is viewable on the Logs tab of the mobile service in the Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: In the event of an error, the code will add an error log entry which is viewable on the Logs tab of the mobile service in the Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: Log on to the [Azure Management Portal], click Mobile Services, and then click your app.
trans-unit.target: Log on to the [Azure Management Portal], click Mobile Services, and then click your app.

trans-unit.source: Click the Push tab, check Enable unauthenticated push notifications, then click Save.
trans-unit.target: Click the Push tab, check Enable unauthenticated push notifications, then click Save.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Mobile Services Push tab</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Mobile Services Push tab</linkText>

trans-unit.source: This tutorial uses MPNS in unauthenticated mode.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial uses MPNS in unauthenticated mode.

trans-unit.source: In this mode, MPNS limits the number of notifications that can be sent to a device channel.
trans-unit.target: In this mode, MPNS limits the number of notifications that can be sent to a device channel.

trans-unit.source: To remove this restriction, you must generate and upload a certificate by clicking Upload and selecting the certificate.
trans-unit.target: To remove this restriction, you must generate and upload a certificate by clicking Upload and selecting the certificate.

trans-unit.source: For more information on generating the certificate, see Setting up an authenticated web service to send push notifications for Windows Phone.
trans-unit.target: For more information on generating the certificate, see Setting up an authenticated web service to send push notifications for Windows Phone.

trans-unit.source: This enables the mobile service to connect to MPNS in unauthenticated mode to send push notifications.
trans-unit.target: This enables the mobile service to connect to MPNS in unauthenticated mode to send push notifications.

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio, press the F5 key to run the app.
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio, press the F5 key to run the app.

trans-unit.source: You may encounter a 401 Unauthorized RegistrationAuthorizationException when testing on the Windows Phone emulator.
trans-unit.target: You may encounter a 401 Unauthorized RegistrationAuthorizationException when testing on the Windows Phone emulator.

trans-unit.source: This can occur during the RegisterNativeAsync() call because of the way the Windows Phone emulator syncs it's clock with the host PC.
trans-unit.target: This can occur during the RegisterNativeAsync() call because of the way the Windows Phone emulator syncs it's clock with the host PC.

trans-unit.source: It can result in a security token that will be rejected.
trans-unit.target: It can result in a security token that will be rejected.

trans-unit.source: To resolve this simply manually set the clock in the emulator before testing.
trans-unit.target: To resolve this simply manually set the clock in the emulator before testing.

trans-unit.source: In the app, enter the text "hello push" in the textbox, click Save, then immediately click the start button or back button to leave the app.
trans-unit.target: In the app, enter the text "hello push" in the textbox, click Save, then immediately click the start button or back button to leave the app.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Insert text</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Insert text</linkText>

trans-unit.source: This sends an insert request to the mobile service to store the added item.
trans-unit.target: This sends an insert request to the mobile service to store the added item.

trans-unit.source: Notice that the device receives a toast notification that says hello push.
trans-unit.target: Notice that the device receives a toast notification that says hello push.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Push notification received</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Push notification received</linkText>

trans-unit.source: You will not receive the notification when you are still in the app.
trans-unit.target: You will not receive the notification when you are still in the app.

trans-unit.source: To receive a toast notification while the app is active, you must handle the <linkText>ShellToastNotificationReceived</linkText><title></title> event.
trans-unit.target: To receive a toast notification while the app is active, you must handle the <linkText>ShellToastNotificationReceived</linkText><title></title> event.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial demonstrated the basics of enabling a Windows Phone app to use Mobile Services and Notification Hubs to send push notifications.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial demonstrated the basics of enabling a Windows Phone app to use Mobile Services and Notification Hubs to send push notifications.

trans-unit.source: Next, consider completing the next tutorial, [Send push notifications to authenticated users], which shows how to use tags to send push notifications from a Mobile Service to only an authenticated user.
trans-unit.target: Next, consider completing the next tutorial, [Send push notifications to authenticated users], which shows how to use tags to send push notifications from a Mobile Service to only an authenticated user.

trans-unit.source: Consider finding out more about the following Mobile Services and Notification Hubs topics:
trans-unit.target: Consider finding out more about the following Mobile Services and Notification Hubs topics:

trans-unit.target:

trans-unit.source: [What are Notification Hubs?]
trans-unit.target: [What are Notification Hubs?]

trans-unit.source: Learn more about how Notification Hubs works to deliver notifications to your apps across all major client platforms.
trans-unit.target: Learn more about how Notification Hubs works to deliver notifications to your apps across all major client platforms.
